subject: Politics
title: The Middle East Powder Keg
description: Learn The Middle East Powder Keg in one minute.

hook.text: The Middle East has oil, religion, rivalry, and great power meddling. Every crisis ingredient exists in one region.

buildup.text: Israel-Palestine, Iran-Saudi rivalry, and extremist movements make the Middle East the world's most volatile region.

discovery.text: Iran and Saudi Arabia fight a cold war through proxies: Yemen, Syria, Lebanon, and Iraq are all battlegrounds.

twist.text: The Abraham Accords normalized ties between Israel and some Arab states. But the Palestinian issue remains unresolved.

climax.text: US withdrawal from the region creates a vacuum. China and Russia are filling it with arms and investment.

punchline.text: The Middle East has too many conflicts and too few solutions.

quiz.question: What was the significance of the Abraham Accords?
options: They normalized relations between Israel and several Arab states
They ended the Iran-Saudi rivalry permanently
